definitions.definition: Saint Columba of Iona, one of the Gaelic missionary monks who reintroduced Christianity to Scotland during the Dark Ages .
Any of three other Christian saints who bore the name Columba.
A small winter constellation of the northern sky, said to resemble a dove .

main_definition: Saint Columba of Iona, one of the Gaelic missionary monks who reintroduced Christianity to Scotland during the Dark Ages .
secondary_definitions: Any of three other Christian saints who bore the name Columba.
( astronomy ) A small winter constellation of the northern sky, said to resemble a dove .
